item.title: Election Section: Spanish General Elections: the Rise of the Far-Right Wakes Up Left Parties
item.author: Jorge Martínez,
item.description: This Sunday, Spain faced its second general election of the year, the country seeking a new government after President Pedro Sánchez failed to build a coalition after the last election in April. At first glance, it seems that not much about Spanish politics has changed. Once more, the Socialist …

item.title: Resurgence of Catalonian Separatist Violence
item.author: Jorge Martínez,
item.description: It’s 10pm in Barcelona. On a street corner, waste bins have been set alight, the noxious smell of burnt plastic penetrating the air. The piercing siren of a police van shatters the silence of the night as it speeds onto the scene. Running towards the van, a group of hooded people begin hurling …
